column1: Data is from EPA EMF-21 data, with some additional data from EDGAR
File also contains further controls in addition to base-year data
OTHER GASES MAIN TABLE:  MUST BE READ IN FIRST
GWP: is gwp by gas, enter 0 to keep these from counting toward greenhouse gas emissions
Input type: 0 is emissions coefficient, 1 is base year emissions -- set default here, make exceptions by source/region if desired using input 804

column5: { Paramaters for GDP control -- set fmax to 0 to disable -- detail by source/region using input 805 }

column1: NOTE: Must have correct region and sector numbers below

column3: METHANE -- base year emissions in Tg CH4  -- SOURCE EMF 21 / EPA 11/02 AND EDGAR v 3.2
N2O -- base year emissions in Tg N  -- SOURCE EMF 21 / EPA 11/02 AND EDGAR v 3.2
*** NOTE ***  The model is hardcoded (erbinput.f90) to accept gas 2 (N2O) in units of N -- it converts back to units of N2O when the data is read for internal consistency

column4: Default gamma is 1;  this one is set to .25 to scale back industrial ch4 emissions (which otherwise go with GDP)
Default gamma is 1;  this one is set to .25 to scale back chemicals n2o emissions (which otherwise go with GDP)
Default gamma is 1;  this one is set to .25 to scale back chemicals n2o emissions (which otherwise go with GDP)

column18: FSU -> 2.8 x US (based on actual prod data)

US and WEUR -> 20% redux. -- deving + REF -> WEUR long run
uses avg dev regions as base, up to 2x base coef for hot regions (temps below)
used to calculate manure emiss (assume dev avg as baseline coef for "cool" regions, linear interp from 13 (cool) to 26 (hot, where hot coef is 2x cool coef per IPCC tier 1)
